p: In 2018, the United States was the second-largest producer of fossil fuels, according to data from The Global Carbon Atlas 2018, but CO2 emissions are projected to fall by 7.5%. China's combustion of less coal in February 2020, a reduction equivalent to the amount used over an entire year in a small European country, is sufficient to prevent growth in this year's emissions.26 It is estimated that continental Europe will produce 390 million tons of CO2 by 2020.27 The Breakthrough Institute in California also predicted that global greenhouse gas emissions would be 0.5 to 2.2% lower.40
